blurb: It took awhile, but the Huskies overcame a sluggish first half in which they led 10-7 at the break and overwhelmed Rutgers in the second half for a satisfying 30-14 nonconference road win. UW must shore up the running game, which gained just 84 yards and find alternate downfield receiving targets other than Dante Pettis. This week: Against Montana.

The Trojans led 35-31 with 4:37 remaining before a pair of late touchdowns sealed a 49-31victory over Western Michigan at The Coliseum. The Trojans wonâ€™t stay unbeaten for long unless they fix a leaky run defense that allowed 263 yards. QB Sam Darnold tossed 2 INTs and failed to throw a touchdown in his first start, which put a chill on his Heisman Trophy campaign. This week: Against Stanford.
